articles.title: Brazil’s Supreme Court imposes steep sentences for Marielle Franco murder
articles.summary: The shooting of Franco, an activist, raised questions about political violence and corruption in Brazil's government.

articles.title: The Papers: 'Met exposed Hoyle' and 'Iran tempts Trump'
articles.summary: The Met's apology for revealing a source related to Lord Mandelson's arrest is prominent on Thursday's papers.

articles.title: This coastal idyll banned 'harmful' holiday lets. Eight years on, has it worked?
articles.summary: A ban on new holiday homes sees more permanent residents but some say the policy harms tourism.

articles.title: North Korea: US relations depend on Washington's attitude
articles.summary: North Korean ruler Kim Jong Un said that the ball is in Washington's court when it comes to relations with the United States. However, he added that Pyongyang has "absolutely no business" with South Korea.

articles.title: Death toll in Brazilian floods rises to 46 as rescuers continue search
articles.summary: Emergency workers continue to search for missing residents of towns reeling from recent floods.

articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,463
articles.summary: These are the key developments from day 1,463 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

articles.title: Kim signals openness to US ties while calling South Korea ‘most hostile’
articles.summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said on Thursday that Pyongyang could improve relations with Washington if its nuclear status is respected, while hardening his stance on Seoul by labelling it the country’s “most hostile” enemy. His remarks come amid speculation over a possible meeting with US Presid

articles.title: US and Iran to hold talks as pressure for nuclear deal builds
articles.summary: The indirect negotiations are seen as a last-ditch effort to prevent a conflict, but the chances of a nuclear agreement are unclear.

articles.title: There's a solution for e-bike parking chaos - but its not problem free
articles.summary: Introducing dedicated parking bays has not completely solved the issue.

articles.title: Shot in school uniform: BBC reveals police order led to Gen Z protest killings
articles.summary: New evidence reveals what happened when 19 people were shot dead in  Kathmandu last September.

articles.title: Aldi shop staff to receive two pay rises this year
articles.summary: The German budget supermarket is a growing competitor among British supermarkets

articles.title: Racism and 'poor' staff relationships factors in maternity care failings, report finds
articles.summary: The interim report has identified problems "at every stage" of the maternity journey in England.

articles.title: US judge rules Trump policy of ‘third country’ deportations unlawful
articles.summary: US judge says that rapid deportation of migrants to countries other than their own violates due process.

articles.title: Questions for Marcos Jr 40 years after Philippines ‘People Power’ revolt
articles.summary: President Ferdinand Marcos Jr urged to dismantle system of political dynasties said to breed culture of corruption.

articles.title: Four shot dead on US-registered speedboat by border guards, Cuba says
articles.summary: The identities of those on board - including six others who were wounded - is unclear.

articles.title: Will Mexico’s Jalisco cartel’s violent biz model survive El Mencho’s death?
articles.summary: El Mencho consolidated Mexico’s most powerful criminal organisations in part due to a unique franchise-based structure.

articles.title: Cuba coast guard kills 4 on Florida-registered boat
articles.summary: Cuba’s government said Wednesday that its soldiers killed four people aboard a speed boat registered in Florida that opened fire on officers in Cuban waters. Cuba’s Interior Ministry issued a statement that provided few details about the shooting, but noted that the boat was roughly 1.6 km northeast

articles.title: North Korea's Kim pledges economic push as his sister is elevated at party congress
articles.summary: Members of North Korea's ruling Workers' Party have been gathering in Pyongyang this week, where Kim Jong Un is pledging to boost the economy over the next fives years. While there's been no sign of his daughter, who's emerged as Kim's heir apparent, the secretive leader has promoted his sister to t

articles.title: Zelenskyy speaks with Trump about peace efforts, eyes leaders-level talks
articles.summary: Conversation precedes meeting between US and Ukrainian envoys in Geneva on Thursday.

articles.title: Watch: BBC on streets of Mexican city gripped by deadly cartel violence
articles.summary: BBC international correspondent Quentin Sommerville travelled to Culiacán in northern Sinaloa state following an explosion in violence.

articles.title: State of the Union: Trump makes false, misleading claims about immigration, economy
articles.summary: During his State of the Union speech, U.S. President Donald Trump made a slew of false or misleading claims including about the U.S. economy, immigration and his role in ending wars. France 24's Charlotte Hughes takes a closer look.

articles.title: Berlinale executives summoned over film director's anti-Israel speech
articles.summary: German culture officials plan to summon organisers of the Berlin film festival Thursday after the event was rocked this year by controversy over the Israel-Palestinian conflict and Gaza war. Bild daily reported that Tricia Tuttle, the US director of the Berlinale, is expected to be sacked at the mee

articles.title: Mexico prepares for 40-hour workweek by 2030 in major labour overhaul
articles.summary: Mexico's ruling Morena party hailed the bill's successful passage after years of back-and-forth with business owners.

articles.title: Iceland to hold EU referendum 'in the coming months', PM says
articles.summary: Iceland ​will hold a referendum "in the coming months" on restarting European ​Union accession talks, Prime Minister Kristrun Frostadottir said on Wednesday during a visit to Poland. FRANCE 24's August Hakansson reports.

articles.title: Paris Saint-Germain edge Monaco to reach Champions League last 16
articles.summary: Paris Saint-Germain survived a tense night against Monaco on Wednesday, drawing the second leg but advancing on aggregate after playing much of the match against 10 men. Late drama and a red card shifted momentum as the holders did just enough to secure their place in the Champions League last 16.

articles.title: Vinicius hits winner as Real Madrid eliminate Benfica from Champions League
articles.summary: Aurelien Tchouameni and Vinicius Jr ⁠score to ⁠help Madrid fight back in playoff second-leg to grab a 3-1 aggregate win.

articles.title: Poland charges ex-intel chiefs for using Israel’s Pegasus spyware
articles.summary: Former officials face up to three years in prison if convicted for failing in their duties.

articles.title: Ukraine alleges Russia enlists more than 1,700 Africans to fight
articles.summary: Ghana's foreign minister says many of the Africans are victims of deception, lured by ⁠the promise of jobs.

articles.title: Senegal PM vows to double penalty for same-sex relations
articles.summary: In tonight's edition, Washington is set to cut health aid to Zimbabwe after negotiations over a US-proposed funding deal break down. Also, Senegalese Prime Minister Ousmane Sonko announces revamped legislation set to double the maximum penalty for same-sex relations to 10 years in prison. And on a r

articles.title: Four killed in firefight between Cuban coastguard and Florida-registered speedboat
articles.summary: A confrontation in Cuban waters left four people dead on Wednesday after soldiers opened fire on a Florida-registered speedboat that Havana says attacked first. Washington is investigating whether any victims were US citizens, as the incident threatens to deepen already strained relations between th

articles.title: Faisal Islam: Is Reeves right in saying the UK economy's turning a corner?
articles.summary: The Chancellor is trying to use this moment as a launching pad for a wider attempt to gee up consumer and business confidence.

articles.title: India’s Modi tells Israel’s Knesset: ‘No cause justifies killing civilians’
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hailed the 'vital' partnership between Israel and India during his visit.

articles.title: Modi, Netanyahu praise each other in address to Israeli Knesset
articles.summary: Narendra Modi and Benjamin Netanyahu spoke of each other’s countries in civilisational terms to the Israeli Knesset.

articles.title: Mexico will make 'a strong show of security' ahead of World Cup, expert says
articles.summary: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Mark Owen, Nathan P. Jones, Associate Professor of Security Studies in the College of Criminal Justice at Sam Houston State University, says that "the Mexican government will be making a strong show of security as a matter of national pride" ahead of the World Cup in the af

articles.title: Met apologises to Commons Speaker for sharing Mandelson tip-off
articles.summary: Sir Lindsay Hoyle tells MPs he was acting "in good faith as is my duty and responsibility" as he felt information was "relevant".

articles.title: US greenlights resale of Venezuelan oil to Cuba
articles.summary: US President Trump had vowed to stop Venezuelan oil from reaching Cuba, sparking a crisis on the island. Now the US government is easing its restrictions as top US diplomat Rubio meets concerned Caribbean leaders.

articles.title: Influential economist Larry Summers to depart Harvard over Epstein ties
articles.summary: Former Harvard President Summers quits after disclosures about his correspondence with Jeffrey Epstein.

articles.title: Cuban coast guard kills 4 in US-flagged speedboat
articles.summary: The Cuban Interior Ministry said the US boat fired at the Cuban coast guard, injuring the Cuban commander of the vessel. The incident comes amid heightened tensions between Cuba and the US.

articles.title: Massive sinkhole swallows two cars in Nebraska
articles.summary: A sinkhole suddenly opened at an intersection in Omaha, Nebraska, swallowing two cars stopped at a red light.

articles.title: BBC broadcast of racial slur at Baftas unacceptable, says culture secretary
articles.summary: The broadcast of a racial slur at the Bafta Film Awards was "completely unacceptable and harmful", the culture secretary says.

articles.title: Suspect arrested in Germany in 2025 Ukrainian aide's killing
articles.summary: A person suspected of shooting a former Ukrainian politician in a wealthy suburb of Madrid in 2025 has been arrested in Heinsberg, in western Germany.

articles.title: Cuban border agents fire upon Florida-tagged speedboat, killing four
articles.summary: The Cuban Interior Ministry has said in a statement that it reserves the right to 'protect its territorial waters'.

articles.title: Why do we miss 2016?
articles.summary: First of a series exploring the defining moments of the past decade.

articles.title: Brazil politicians convicted for ordering murder of black activist councilor
articles.summary: Brazil's Supreme Court on Wednesday convicted two former lawmakers of ordering the 2018 assassination of Rio de Janeiro councilwoman Marielle Franco, a popular black activist whose murder exposed deep ties between politics and organized crime. Franco, an LGBTQ activist who grew up in a favela and be

articles.title: Sudan: RSF targeted the disabled in el-Fasher, HRW alleges
articles.summary: A new Human Rights Watch report accuses the Rapid Support Forces militia in Sudan of intentionally targeting and, in some cases, summarily executing civilians with disabilities during its 2025 takeover of el-Fasher.

articles.title: Justice Department accused of withholding and removing some Epstein files related to Trump
articles.summary: This Wednesday it has emerged that there could be missing information in the Epstein Files, in particular relating to a woman who accused Donald Trump of sexual assault decades ago. Democrat lawmaker Robert Garcia has flagged up the missing links. Garcia is on the House Oversight committee. FRANCE 2

articles.title: Loosening grip? Trump skirts setbacks in State of the Union speech
articles.summary: What does a boss who’s built an image as a tough guy from Queens do when naysayers claim he's reached his limits? To dispel doubts, he can for instance hold the floor for an hour and 47 minutes. In the longest ever State of the Union address, Donald Trump proving he can stick to script instead of ra

articles.title: Russia considers fuel support for Cuba as Canada pledges food aid
articles.summary: A US-imposed fuel embargo has threatened to spark a humanitarian crisis in Cuba, whose energy grid relies on fossil fuel

articles.title: What El Mencho’s death means for Mexico’s cartels
articles.summary: Mexico kills cartel leader El Mencho. Violence erupts nationwide. What changes now?

articles.title: Cuba: Technological Disobedience
articles.summary: In US-blockaded Cuba, ingenious mechanics and inventors revive old machines to survive during a time of scarcity.

articles.title: Modi: India stands with Israel 'with full conviction'
articles.summary: Indian Prime Minister Modi is on a two-day visit to Israel and gave a speech at the Knesset. Modi hailed the relationship between the two countries, with Prime Minister Netanyahu calling him a "brother."

articles.title: World Central Kitchen calls international community not to forget Kyiv and Gaza
articles.summary: Today in Spotlight, we speak with celebrity Chef José Andrés. The founder of World Food Kitchen talks of his Longer Tables Fund's matching donations to support critical energy infrastructure in Ukraine, Gaza where his charity provides one million hot meals a day... and more.

articles.title: After El Mencho's death, what lies ahead for Mexico’s Jalisco New Generation Cartel?
articles.summary: The killing of Nemesio "El Mencho" Oseguera Cervantes, leader of the powerful Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), marked a turning point in Mexico’s long war against organised crime. But after his death triggered unrest across the country this week, fears are mounting that internal rivalries and t

articles.title: Yungblud festival goes international, but not everyone's convinced
articles.summary: The third instalment is taking place in the Czech Republic after being held in Milton Keynes.

articles.title: US-Iran nuclear talks: Deal or military strike?
articles.summary: With Washington amassing military force in the Middle East, US and Iranian representatives are again meeting in Geneva on Tehran's nuclear program. Hopes for a breakthrough are slim.

articles.title: Former Brazil lawmakers convicted of ordering murder of Rio councilwoman Marielle Franco
articles.summary: Two former politicians were convicted by Brazil’s Supreme Court on Wednesday of ordering the 2018 assassination of Rio de Janeiro councilwoman and activist Marielle Franco, whose murder exposed a web of corruption linking political figures to organised crime.

articles.title: Man accused of driving wife to suicide claims she lied about abuse, jury told
articles.summary: Christopher Trybus, 43, is charged with manslaughter, coercive control and two counts of rape.

articles.title: DR Congo govt forces launch attacks on multiple fronts against AFC/M23 troops
articles.summary: Kinshasa's forces launched attacks on several fronts against AFC/M23 rebels in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DR Congo) on Wednesday, with drones striking the armed group near a strategic mining site, local and security sources told AFP on Wednesday.

articles.title: John Lewis pulls out of housebuilding business
articles.summary: The retailer began expanding into housebuilding in 2020 but it is scrapping those plans to focus on retail instead.

articles.title: 'Fear is everywhere': BBC reports from Mexican city turned into war zone by drug cartel feud
articles.summary: Culiacán in northern Mexico has seen a surge in violence as rival factions of the Sinaloa cartel battle for control.

articles.title: Germany news: Bundestag passes major drone deal
articles.summary: German politicians approved, with some changes, a massive drone deal, despite concerns about US billionaire Peter Thiel's involvement. Meanwhile, Chancellor Merz has arrived in China. DW has the latest.

articles.title: Turkey: CPR performed on seagull during a Turkish football match
articles.summary: After hitting a seagull with the ball, a footballer administered emergency CPR to it during a match in Istanbul.

articles.title: UK government denies Chagos Islands deal is paused, after minister said it was
articles.summary: It come after a minister said the UK is discussing "concerns" with the US, after President Trump criticised the deal.

articles.title: Watch: Moment a sinkhole in Omaha traps cars and drivers
articles.summary: Several witnesses jumped into action helping both drivers get to safety while others directed traffic, according to police.

articles.title: Hungary's Orban accuses Kyiv of plotting energy disruption
articles.summary: Viktor Orban has escalated a dispute with Ukraine, accusing it of planning to disrupt his country's energy system. But the EU says neither Hungary nor Slovakia is at risk of oil shortages.

articles.title: From forbidden gay love to kinky queer romance: The latest film releases
articles.summary: In this edition of our film show, critic Emma Jones talks to Eve Jackson about the latest film releases, including "The History of Sound" from director Oliver Hermanus. It stars Paul Mescal and Josh O'Connor as two men who fall in love in the shadow of World War I. The film premiered in competition

articles.title: Nickolay Mladenov: the Bulgarian leading the Board of Peace
articles.summary: As director-general of Donald Trump's Board of Peace and High Representative for Gaza, Bulgarian Nickolay Mladenov faces a massive challenge. Who is the man tasked with implementing the US-brokered peace plan for Gaza?

articles.title: Anthropic: Is the Pentagon overreaching on AI access?
articles.summary: Anthropic, a much vaunted AI startup, is firmly in the Trump administration's sights. The Pentagon wants complete access to its models, despite safety and ethical concerns.

articles.title: New Louvre director tasked with leading a beleaguered landmark out of decades of crisis
articles.summary: Art historian and president of France's Versailles Palace Christophe Leribault is taking the reins of the world’s most famous museum, a day after his predecessor submitted her resignation. Leribault faces the daunting task of steering the Louvre out of decades of crisis and reinforcing security afte

articles.title: Trump keeps world waiting on his plans for Iran after State of the Union
articles.summary: The next round of talks between the US and Iran in Geneva on Thursday could be decisive in the president's decision-making.

articles.title: Chagos Islands deal sows confusion over UK minister remarks
articles.summary: The BBC said a government source has denied that the UK Parliament has halted a ratification process to turn over the control of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius. It comes after a UK minister said the process was paused.

articles.title: Berlinale director could be dismissed amid polarized Gaza debate: reports
articles.summary: The Minister of State for Culture intends to replace festival head Tricia Tuttle, according to reports by "Bild." A Palestinian award-winner's accusation that Germany supports genocide had sparked political backlash.

articles.title: Fact check: Trump's State of the Union address debunked
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump delivered the longest State of the Union speech in modern history with statements on the economy, migration as well as bold claims about how he's ended wars. A DW Fact check.

articles.title: Modi's Israel trip tests India's Middle East balancing act
articles.summary: As India's defense ties with Israel grow and the Gaza conflict casts a long shadow, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi visits Tel Aviv. The trip tests India's bid for strategic gains amid rising regional tensions.

articles.title: Merz in China: German chancellor, Xi seek more cooperation
articles.summary: Friedrich Merz said he saw a "great opportunity" for the industrial exporters, while Xi Jinping called for "enhanced strategic cooperation." China has been courting Western leaders amid Trump's trade tensions.

articles.title: Australia PM bomb threat linked to Chinese dance show
articles.summary: Australia's prime minister was briefly removed from his home after a threat alleging explosives had been planted nearby. The alert was later linked to controversy over a performance by Chinese dance group Shen Yun.

articles.title: US states begin plugging into balcony solar
articles.summary: Simple, money-saving plug-in solar systems are taking off in the US, despite the best efforts by the Trump administration to quash the shift toward renewable energy.

articles.title: Journalist deaths reach new high in 2025 — CPJ
articles.summary: A record number of journalists and media workers were killed in 2025 for a second year in a row, the press freedom organization said. It blamed Israeli forces for two-thirds of the deaths.

articles.title: Why scientists fear Emperor penguins' annual moult may be killing them
articles.summary: Each year the birds must stay on floating ice long enough to replace their weather-beaten feathers.

articles.title: New head of German Catholics pledges reform
articles.summary: The number of Christians in Germany is declining, and society is divided. However, Heiner Wilmer, the new chairman of the German Catholic Bishops' Conference, is calling for unity and dialogue.
